title: Al Jean
summary: Alfred Ernest Jean III (born January 9, 1961) is an American writer, animator, and producer.[1] Jean is well known for his work on The Simpsons and SpongeBob SquarePants. He was born and raised near Detroit, Michigan, and graduated from Harvard University in 1981. Jean began his writing career in the 1980s with fellow Harvard alum Mike Reiss. Together, they worked as writers and producers on television shows such as The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson, ALF and It's Garry Shandling's Show.
